titleStmt.title: Something that lately passed in discourse between the King and R.H. published to prevent the mistakes and errors in a copy lately printed contrary to the knowledge or intention of the party concerned ... therefore it was thought convenient for the removing of errors and mistakes to be reprinted in a more true form and order for the satisfaction of others [by] R. H.
titleStmt.author: Hubberthorn, Richard, 1628-1662.
Charles II, King of England, 1630-1685.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
